skill.name: agent-framework
skill.description: Create AI agents and workflows using Microsoft Agent Framework SDK. Supports single-agent and multi-agent workflow patterns. USE FOR: create agent, build agent, scaffold agent, new agent, agent framework, workflow pattern, multi-agent, MCP tools, create workflow. DO NOT USE FOR: deploying agents (use deploy), evaluating agents (use agent/evaluate), Azure AI Foundry agents without Agent Framework SDK.
skill.summary: Create AI agents and workflows using Microsoft Agent Framework SDK with support for single-agent and multi-agent patterns.
skill.author: microsoft

security_audit.summary: This is an official Microsoft skill for creating AI agents using Microsoft Agent Framework SDK. The static scanner flagged 165 potential issues, but evaluation confirms all are false positives. The flagged backtick patterns are Markdown code fences in documentation files. The skill appropriately uses .env files for storing Azure Foundry credentials (FOUNDRY_PROJECT_ENDPOINT, FOUNDRY_MODEL_DEPLOYMENT_NAME), which is a standard and secure practice for credential management.

medium_findings.title: Environment File Access
medium_findings.description: The skill creates .env files to store Azure Foundry project endpoint and model deployment name credentials.

content.user_title: Build AI agents with Microsoft Agent Framework
content.value_statement: Create AI agents and multi-agent workflows using Microsoft Agent Framework SDK. This skill scaffolds agent projects with tools, HTTP server support, and VSCode debugging configurations for enterprise AI applications.
actual_capabilities: Scaffold new AI agent projects using Microsoft Agent Framework Python SDK
Build multi-agent workflows with orchestration patterns (linear, parallel, loop)
Add HTTP server mode to agents using Azure AI Agent Server SDK
Configure VSCode debugging with AI Toolkit Agent Inspector
Set up MCP (Model Context Protocol) tools for agents
Generate .vscode launch configurations for F5 debugging
limitations: Requires Azure AI Foundry project and deployed model
Does not handle agent deployment (use separate deploy skill)
Does not evaluate agent performance (use separate evaluate skill)

use_cases.title: Enterprise AI Application Development
use_cases.description: Build production AI agents with type safety, checkpointing, and orchestration for enterprise Azure environments.
use_cases.target_user: Enterprise developers building AI-powered business applications

use_cases.title: Multi-Agent Workflow Prototyping
use_cases.description: Create and test multi-agent workflows with Writer-Reviewer patterns, loops, and human-in-the-loop interactions.
use_cases.target_user: AI engineers prototyping complex agent interactions

use_cases.title: VSCode Debugging Setup
use_cases.description: Configure local debugging with AI Toolkit Agent Inspector for interactive agent testing and troubleshooting.
use_cases.target_user: Developers who prefer VSCode for agent development and debugging

prompt_templates.title: Create Basic Agent
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new AI agent using Microsoft Agent Framework that can respond to user queries. Include HTTP server mode support.
prompt_templates.scenario: Basic agent setup with minimal configuration

prompt_templates.title: Create Agent with Tools
prompt_templates.prompt: Build an agent with custom tools using the function calling pattern. Add at least 2 custom tools for the agent to use.

prompt_templates.title: Create Multi-Agent Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a multi-agent workflow with a Writer agent that generates content and a Reviewer agent that provides feedback. Use the workflow builder pattern.

prompt_templates.title: Create Loop Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a multi-agent loop workflow where a Teacher agent and Student agent interact. Include turn-based control with a maximum of 5 iterations.
prompt_templates.scenario: Bidirectional agent workflow with loop control

output_examples.input: Create a new agent called 'WeatherAgent' that can tell the weather
output_examples.output: The skill generates: requirements.txt with pinned agent-framework versions, main.py with ChatAgent setup and weather tool, .env file template for FOUNDRY_PROJECT_ENDPOINT and FOUNDRY_MODEL_DEPLOYMENT_NAME, .vscode/launch.json and .vscode/tasks.json for debugging

The skill generates: A Writer executor that creates content, A Reviewer executor that provides feedback, WorkflowBuilder configuration with edges connecting the two agents, run_stream event handling for real-time output

best_practices: Always use pinned SDK versions (1.0.0b260107 for agent-framework) to avoid breaking changes from beta releases
Use virtual environments (.venv) to isolate dependencies and avoid conflicts
Configure HTTP server mode as the default entry point for better debugging and containerization support
Pin environment variables in .env file but remind users to update values before running
anti_patterns: Using bare 'python' or 'pip' commands without virtual environment activation
Skipping the server mode when the user needs HTTP endpoint access
Using legacy AzureAIAgentClient instead of current AzureAIClient
Not pinning SDK versions leading to breaking changes from beta releases

faq.question: What programming language does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill supports Python only. The Microsoft Agent Framework SDK for JavaScript/TypeScript requires a different skill.

faq.question: Do I need an Azure subscription?
faq.answer: Yes, you need an Azure AI Foundry project with a deployed model. The skill will help you configure the FOUNDRY_PROJECT_ENDPOINT and FOUNDRY_MODEL_DEPLOYMENT_NAME environment variables.

faq.question: Can I debug agents locally?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill generates .vscode configurations for debugging with AI Toolkit Agent Inspector. This provides interactive debugging and message flow visualization.

faq.question: What is MCP in this context?
faq.answer: MCP (Model Context Protocol) is a standard for connecting AI agents to external tools. The skill supports both stdio-based and HTTP-based MCP tools.

faq.question: Why pin SDK versions?
faq.answer: The agent-framework SDK is in preview (beta). Version 1.0.0b260107 is stable. Later versions may have breaking changes like renamed classes (AgentRunResponseUpdate vs AgentResponseUpdate).

faq.question: What is Agent-as-Server pattern?
faq.answer: This pattern wraps your agent/workflow in an HTTP server using azure-ai-agentserver packages. It enables containerization, deployment to Azure Foundry, and integration with other services.
